content.title: Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Scheduled Caste students studying at post matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education. Scholarships will be paid to the students whose parents/guardians' income from all sources does not exceed Rs. 2,50,000/- (Rupees two lakh, fifty thousand only) per annum.
benefits: Compulsory non-refundable fees including tuition fees
Academic Allowance based on course category
eligibility: Candidates belonging to Scheduled Castes specified by the State/UT
Passed Matriculation or Higher Secondary or any higher examination of a recognized University or Board
Parents' income does not exceed Rs. 2,50,000/- per annum
Students pursuing studies through correspondence/online courses are also eligible
exclusions: Students studying in the same stage of education in a different subject are not eligible
Students who hold other scholarships/stipends cannot receive this scholarship
content.application_process: Applicants need to visit the official website, click on the registration link, select the application form, fill out the required information, upload the documents/certificate, and submit the application.

faqs.question: What is Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste Scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial assistance to the Scheduled Caste students studying at post matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be a native of India resident in Punjab, must hold at least a 12th standard passing certificate from a recognized school, and must enroll in a degree course in a government college.

faqs.question: Which documents are required?
faqs.answer: Resident proof, Aadhar card, Admission proof, Previous academic records, Photograph, Scanned signatures, Bank account details, and other significant documents.

faqs.question: What are the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Get Financial Assistance from the government based on the Category of Opted courses.
